results.title: People's holiday
results.brief_description: Danish law provides that every worker in Demark is entitled to annual holidays in summer. Trades Unions and Workers Cooperatives have established Folk Ferie, an organization which arranges holidays and maintains youth hostels and beach holiday towns. Other activities include the provision of farm holidays for city industrial workers and the arrangement of international holidays.

results.title: People's dictator
results.brief_description: This is a portrait of Chinese politician Deng Xiao Ping, a man who holds no official office in China, but runs the country as a virtual dictator. He has been credited as beign the one man who brought China from the brink of starvation to become one of the leading developing nations of the world. His policy of socialism is viewed by many in the West as being a form of Capitalism, but he will be remembered most by his people as the one dictator in 5,000 years of Chinese history who was determined to suppress a non-violent protest with extreme force - Tienamen Square.

results.title: People
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “American Enterprise”.
Tom Novak, community college professor of Ethnic Studies, visits Ellis Island, where he reminisces about the early immigrants (16 million between 1890 and 1930) who helped shape America. Novak introduces us to some of their descendants in their homes and businesses. Japanese florists in California, Portuguese fishermen in Massachusetts and an Afro-American family in Long Island are featured. Narrated by William Shatner.

results.title: Penny and Ann
results.brief_description: Penny, aged about 18, is partially blind and has been attending the Lethbridge Rehabilitation Centre where Ann, her occupational therapist, works on a programme of activities for daily living.

results.title: Peninsular pioneers
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “National Trust”.
Describes the country buildings of Arthur’s Seat or McCrae Cottage 1844, the Church of St James the Less 1865, Heronswood 1871, and Baragunda 1866.

results.title: Penicillin: the magic bullet
results.creator_credit: Arcimedia, Claire Jager and Gordon Glenn
results.brief_description: In 1945 the Nobel Prize for medicine was awarded to three men - Alexander Fleming, Ernst Chain, and the Australian, Howard Florey - as the inventors of penicillin, the “magic bullet” of medicine. This doumentary tells the true story behind the discovery of penicillin, the wonder drug of the twentieth century, which would change the face of modern civilisation by providing a cure for medical scourges such as pneumonia, meningitis, rheumatic fever, septicaemia and venereal diseases. Using dramatic re-enactments, “Penicillin : the magic bullet” charts the work of the Howard Florey’s team (including that of the overlooked Norman Heatley) as they struggled towards this medical breakthrough. Narrated by Martin Jacobs.

results.title: Penguin island: Australia's little penguins
results.creator_credit: Gordon Badham, BandG Communications and Patrick Gillespie
results.brief_description: Hosted by Peter Hoskings, this is a tourist orientated film that never the less provides a wealth of facts and figures about the fairy penguins, and background information about Phillip Island. Excellent cinematography reveals much about the scenary and wild life of the island including koalas, kangaroos and wallabies, wombats, seals, wild flowers and birds.

results.title: Penguin Island
results.brief_description: A film record of the various types of animal life found by the Australian National Antarctic Research Expedition (1948-1950) during their stay on Macquarie Island. Shows many species of seals, penguins and birds, including the Great Wandering Albatross. Recordings of sounds made by penguins are used in the introduction to the film.

results.title: Pencils
results.brief_description: Scenes showing children and adults writing, drawing, and doodling with every imaginable kind of pencil are intercut with sequences filmed at a factory where pencils are manufactured. The variety of pencils, sizes, shapes, colours and uses are conveyed without narration but with a lively musical score.
